notices.title: custom-resources: `State functionActiveV2 not found` is thrown when using a custom resource whose provider Lambda has become `INACTIVE`
notices.overview: If the custom resource provider Lambda becomes `INACTIVE`, the custom resource provider framework attempts to call `functionActiveV2()` to wait for the function to become active. This throws the error because the SDK installed by Lambda is at version 2.1055.0, but `functionActiveV2` does not exist until 2.1080.0.

notices.title: core: Names of deployed stacks change, requiring redeployment
notices.overview: The names of stacks that contain special characters (such as '-') are incorrectly sanitized. This is a breaking change to the names of stacks that have already been deployed.

notices.title: aws-wafv2: The structs naming pattern changes from FooAction to Foo
notices.overview: The structs naming pattern changes from AllowAction, BlockAction, CaptchaAction, ChallengeAction and CountAction to Allow, Block, Captcha, Challenge and Count respectively.

notices.title: triggers: Deployment of trigger functions fails with a type error
notices.overview: The Trigger and TriggerFunction constructs fail to deploy when upgrading.

notices.title: aws-iam: IAM OIDC provider configures the wrong certificate thumbprint
notices.overview: Your application is using the iam.OpenIDConnectProvider resource, which currently configures the thumbprint of the leaf certificate instead of the root. Since leaf certificates are rotated more frequently, you are in danger of application errors next time those certificates get rotated. See the attached issue for mitigation steps and apply them as soon as possible.

notices.title: apigateway: Unable to serialize value as aws-cdk-lib.aws_apigateway.IModel
notices.overview: Users of CDK in any language other than TS/JS cannot use values that return an instance of a deprecated class.

notices.title: cli: cdk init produces EACCES: permission denied and does not fill the directory
notices.overview: The CLI is unable to initialize new apps if CDK is installed globally in a directory owned by root

notices.title: cli: no stacks are deployed if the `--exclusively` (`-e`) flag is used
notices.overview: When the `--exclusively` flag is used to select stacks with dependencies, instead no stacks are deployed at all and the deployment silently no-ops.

notices.title: (aws-eks): Regression in installing Helm charts from assets
notices.overview: Helm charts fail to install when provided as an asset. This issue does not affect charts installed from a repository.

notices.title: AWS CDK v1 End-of-Support June 1, 2023
notices.overview: AWS CDK v1 is currently in maintenance mode. Support for AWS CDK v1 will end entirely on June 1, 2023. Migrate to AWS CDK v2 to continue to get the latest features and fixes!

notices.title: (aws-ec2): VPCs with SubnetType.PRIVATE cause resource destruction on versions >=v1.162.0, <=1.163.2
notices.overview: On upgrading to versions >=v1.162.0 & <=1.163.2 and using SubnetType.PRIVATE in a VPC subnetConfiguration, some of the VPC resources will be destroyed.

notices.title: (ecs-patterns) NLB-fronted services may cause target groups to be replaced on upgrade
notices.overview: Upgrading to versions >=1.141.0 or >=2.9.0 may cause target groups to be replaced when using NetworkLoadBalancedFargateService or NetworkLoadBalancedEc2Service.
